p: Community assembly generally decreased plant biomass of I. conyzae (from 0.66 ± 0.07 g to 0.25 ± 0.02 g; P = 0.007 × 10 −4). However, this decrease was significant only in M+ plants Fig. 4. P content of native I. conyzae was also consistently ( P = 0.001 × 10 −3) greater in mycorrhizal plants (1.6 ± 0.2 mg), compared to those without mycorrhizal inoculation (0.6 ± 0.1 mg), except in the multicrop following disturbance, where the effect of mycorrhizal inoculation was not observed Fig. 4. P content of native I. conyzae was consistently ( P = 0.003 × 10 −4) lower (0.5 ± 0.1 mg) when grown with the invasive, compared to monocrop pots (1.7 ± 0.3 mg), however, the decrease was significant only in M+ pots Fig. 4.
